data.title: The Inquisitive Physician; The Life and Times of George Richards Minot. by Rackemann, Francis M.: (1956)
data.meta_description: 1st Edition - Hardcover - Cambridge MA, Harvard University Press. - 1956 - Dust Jacket Included - First Edition, First Printing. -- Dr. Minot had an inquiring mind; as a teenager he wrote a scientific study of insect eggs. He was researching platelets at the onset of the 1918 flu epidemic, and also an outbreak of chemical poisoning at a war munitions factory. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology and Medicine in 1934 for liver therapy for anemia. -- Hardcover. Condtion: very good, bright (owner name) with heavily chipped but bright dust jacket. - The Inquisitive Physician; The Life and Times of George Richards Minot.
data.text:
About this Item

First Edition, First Printing. -- Dr. Minot had an inquiring mind; as a teenager he wrote a scientific study of insect eggs. He was researching platelets at the onset of the 1918 flu epidemic, and also an outbreak of chemical poisoning at a war munitions factory. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology and Medicine in 1934 for liver therapy for anemia. -- Hardcover. Condtion: very good, bright (owner name) with heavily chipped but bright dust jacket.
